text: <@U0EG5RUBY|artemiy> has joined the channel

<@U061HDV96>: I’d put that header thing to the bottom
after you’ve read the article
you see what’s up
this way it seems to invasive
Perhaps
We're not worrying about cover photos for blog posts I take it?
No, he's talking about this: <https://i.imgur.com/dFZalNy.png>
hmm cover photos
Or
nexus wallpapers
yeah I’m talking bout dat header
I think it should probably just be a button to join the slack community, that is way too big.. if anything it should appear after clicking a button with a bit of js
I could store a cookie that would check whether you're already registered or something
And I was talking about blog posts <@U061HDV96> not the header thing :stuck_out_tongue:
<@U0EQ6UWUQ>: you can use any header as long as it's royalty free or whatever. There will be an imagemagick cli to convert them which is optional.
I'm thinking about making people upload the original *and* compressed version.
In case we change something.

yeah but this is toooo intrusive imho.  Also I’d delete the part that anyone can submit blog posts and they should learn that when they sign up, it’s kinda dumb to have people that are not in the community submit
yeah agreed
I wrote that description quite late, tell me what it should be.
but yeah the slack email/ join form should be something that pops up once they've clicked the button or something
even if it was just a thin bar that once clicked on increases height wise to show the form or somethin
I can do that later. That takes some more time :stuck_out_tongue:
I moved it to the bottom for now.
the description doesn’t need to be big
just something like
>AndroidChat is an open Slack community for Android developers and enthusiasts. >Join us<
Well I wouldn't say Slack community. We want to grow beyond that.
take out Slack, that should do it right? :smile:
Meh, people still need to know there is a Slack. It's quite important :stuck_out_tongue:
well it’s a slack community
it doesn’t mean it’s restricted to slack
<@U0DTM911Q|clement> has joined the channel
but it’s easy to change anytime
yeah leave Slack in there for now at least
When do you reckon we'll have something to play around with?
You can start writing blogs now.
I'm gonna try to write the first blog and push it.
Haha, good to know. What you writing about
Just about the website and the community, nothing much. For new people?
<https://github.com/likealcohol> is my github btw.. hardly used my personal one til now
I'm also thinking about a license
Should I use MIT, GPLv3 or Creative Commons?
It's a blog, but also code.
Ha, thats a good question
I guess that includes content we write
I was more leaning towards MIT
But then again GPLv3. I'm not sure.
meh GPL
hm
license the website code under MIT, and put the content under CC-BY-SA
maybe add a bit of NC to that CC
depends
yeah that sounds like a good shot
I know many blogs that work under CC-BY-SA
<@U04TK850N>: I was looking at Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International
(Copy pasted that from their website :stuck_out_tongue: )
yeah, that is what I said :stuck_out_tongue:
But then again
Is the code in the blog licensed under MIT or CC?
CC is not really a code license
I know
That's why I'm asking
Well then that answers your question
Is that MIT/GPL license referring to the code in the blog too?
yeah code via MIT
Code in posts is part of the content, as long as it’s not otherwise licensed, e.g. you link to your github in the end where the whole code sits
Yeah code would be part of the content if its in a blog post, so the current license should be fine as long as you haven't shared an algorithm to take over the world
I don't need to put that CC right on the website, do I?
How can I put it there without that ugly image they provide? :stuck_out_tongue:
google „cc-by-sa badge"
I just put it in a meta tag.
Then it won’t be worth anything
it needs to be visible
yeah needs to be visible as i don't think it will cover it if its just in the code right? people can claim it wasn't visible
<@U04TK850N>: what if I add the appropriate icons at the bottom? <https://i.imgur.com/WusEeJ9.png>
add all of them :smile:
Looks good to me: <https://i.imgur.com/EMnsDhW.png>
Still need to shorten that text, but yeah icons look good :stuck_out_tongue:
Better without the white background? <https://i.imgur.com/1hVa9uW.png>
both look good tbh, but to keep it consistent with the social icons
i'd go with no background
Ya same
so is there a members group on the github we need to be added to or do we just make a pull request?
btw I think we need some guide lines to follow while making blog posts to keep them consistent if you get what I mean
Yes, I was just gonna ask.
I was gonna write the CONTRIBUTING.md
Good good
<@U04TK850N>: <@U04PLNDN9>: any contributing guidelines?
Quality of images would be a big one I guess
and sizes
Giving credit is pretty important too
Credit isn't always important
well where necessary I guess
CC Zero doesn't require attribution
Oh I see
Royalty free images I take it
Ya, at least.
Or where you own the copyright?
yea
I'll just add that they grant us permission once submitted.
What if it's not their copyright but they have permission?
previously published content allowed?
What do you mean previously published?
as in a blog post they've published elsewhere, but have the rights to
Hmmm...
I wouldn't say we allow that
re-blog idk the term for it xD
Yeah, I wouldn't
if it's not their copyright I wouldn't allow it just in case
non-promotional links?
like affiliate links etc
I would say allow?
could do
if someone is using a link with an adfly or some other ppc website I'd probably not allow that, but I guess referrals are okay
Only in English which I guess is a given?
<@U0EQ6UWUQ>: any kind of link shortening isn't allowed. That includes adfly.
yup good good
Does Github cache the images you post in issues?
also, before merging blogs imho a post PR should have at least 5 OKs
or 3
But who can 'OK'?
slack regulars
instead of some random developer from bangalore jumping in with 3 random accs oking his post
:smile:
are the icons to CC linked?
<@U04TK850N>: linked to the github source.
link to the license text, otherwise it doesn’t make sense
Alright, no problem.
<@U0548MM6B>: you talking about reviewing the posts?
Just to be on the safe side really, not to annoy you :smile:
<@U04TK850N>: what I've got setup makes it pretty easy to edit everything.
Might want to make a separate file for authors though.
yep reviews
<@U0548MM6B>: we can create groups on github
For reviews, how is that going to work?
Reviewers are going to need some guidelines too really, most will be related to contributing ones.. but there will be additional ones I guess
I would have an editors and authors group
Authors would include everyone who has ever posted anything.
for example if I wrote an article tomorrow, it would be reviewed by who?
do we need dedicated reviewers? :smile:
editors :simple_smile:
so if something isn't quite right, they'll edit it themselves instead of just rejecting it and saying what needs to change?
They should comment on the pull request (per line perhaps) and the user should edit it.
is that something that anyone would see?
Regarding file names
They include the date, but that make the blog post 'old' because of the late edit.
What should the max amount of categories allowed be?
what do you mean by that
max amount of categories that is
In Jekyll a post can have categories
They're included in the URL
They can also have tags, which is about the same as categories but are not included in the URL
How many of those should be allowed?
oh i see
not more than three I’d say
That is really enough to describe a post on a high level
2/3 yea
3 is gonna make for a big URL
SEO dude :smile:
then make it 2
<http://androidchat/jekyll/slack/giphy/2014/05/28/Google-IO-2015-Keynote/>
for categories I'd even say 1 but 1-3 is fine I guess
xD
Okay okay 3
And tags?
The same?
that doesn't matter too much if its not in the url right
Then why not make it 1 category and up to 3 tags?
They're in the Atom feed though
I don't think tags are displayed anywhere in the HTML
what <@U04TK850N> said :smile:
<@U04TK850N>: URLs are huge in SEO though :confused:
with 1 category?
I don't know
3 is gonna make it better
3 cats 3 tags i guess
/giphy cats?
categories, sorry got lazy
only 1 hairball though
Regarding titles
Should They Be Like This Google
or
Should they be like this Google
real grammar pls
much title very post wow
like this
Should They Have An Uppercase Letter Every Word But Capital Names For Companies And Other Stuff?
no, that sucks
Good
<https://i.gyazo.com/9ce48c1a7ee15ce1f42821dff1631531.gif>
coolest atom plugin :smile:
So if they want a header and they have to attribute the creator
What then?
attribute the creator?
Yes.. they have to mention you
attribution
but if you make the post?
I'm talking about the header image
You can set that in a post.
What do you guys think of the guideline that the first thing needs to be a paragraph and will be the 'foreword' and will be displayed in italic? <https://i.imgur.com/rkVloPH.png>
tbh, don’t put that many restrictions in or otherwise people will be constantly submitting non-compliant posts and then need to fix it, or we need to and they lose motivation
Optional?
I put it in the CSS that the first paragraph will be a foreword.
But it'll be ignored if there's a title first.
Nah don’t need that
Make a title
maybe a subtitle
and that’s it
<@U0548MM6B>: <https://i.imgur.com/7J6Lsdv.png>
There already is a big title
oh I was thinking that was the title
uh idk then
So make it a foreword if the first element is a paragraph?
I like it when sites do that :stuck_out_tongue:
Or no, I'll remove it
They can use italic if they want a foreword.
editors can do the nitty gritty bits like that no?
They can't add padding though
<@U054L79RL|blad> has joined the channel
Yay
I made it so that if the whole first paragraph is italic, padding is added.
Ok?
So a foreword is possible.

Invalid:
```_first_ _other text_```
```_first_ other text```

Valid:
```_This is the whole text._```

file.preview:
# Contributing

## Reporting issues

Please report all kind of issues via [Github Issues](https://github.com/androidchat/androidchat.github.io/issues). Depending on what kind of issue it is, also provide the relevant additional information:
file.preview_highlight:
# Contributing
​
## Reporting issues
​
Please report all kind of issues via [Github Issues](https://github.com/androidchat/androidchat.github.io/issues). Depending on what kind of issue it is, also provide the relevant additional information:
